paper_abstract: In an orthogonal projection of a convex polyhedron p, the visibility ratio of a face f (of an edge e) is the ratio of orthogonally projected area of f (length of e) and its actual area (length). In this paper, we give algorithms for nice projections of P such that the minimum visibility ratio among all visible facts (among all visible edges) is maximized.
paper_title: COMPUTING NICE PROJECTIONS OF CONVEX POLYHEDRA
